title: How to Prepare Fennel to Cook

steps.headline: Select rounder bulbs, rather than the flattened ones, for the best flavor.
steps.description: The bulbs should be a bright white color without soft spots.

steps.headline: Use a sharp knife to cut away the stems and the root end of the fennel bulbs.
Cut the bulb in half.
steps.description: Remove the tough core from the center of each piece.

steps.headline: Slice the rest of the sweet anise bulb into thin strips.
Serve the raw fennel bulb and fronds in salads.
steps.description: Toss it with a garden salad or slaw for a slight licorice flavor. Mix orange sections, thinly sliced red onions, raw sweet anise, and citrus vinaigrette. Serve the salad on a bed of frisée greens. Combine raw fennel, blood oranges, and black olives for a Mediterranean salad treat. Serve it with toasted pita bread. Chop the sweet anise into smaller pieces, and mix it into tuna or chicken salad. Garnish the salad with a sprinkling of the chopped fronds.

steps.headline: Place 1 tablespoon (14.7 ml) of vegetable oil in a sauté pan, and heat the pan until warm.
steps.description: Place the fennel pieces into the pan, and cook until tender.

steps.headline: Simmer the sliced sweet anise in a tomato sauce as a side dish.
steps.description: Add a pinch of saffron and shrimp for a seafood soup.

steps.headline: Boil the fennel bulb slices until just tender.
steps.description: Drain, and pour them into a casserole or gratin dish you have buttered liberally. Sprinkle the dish with black pepper and Parmesan cheese. Bake the side dish in a 400-degree Fahrenheit (204-degrees Celsius) oven until the cheese is browned and bubbling.

steps.headline: Blanch the thinly sliced sweet anise.
steps.description: Dip it in boiling water for 10 seconds, and then plunge it into ice water. Mix it with eggplant slices or cubes, sliced red onion, and chopped red and yellow bell pepper. Drizzle it with an olive oil vinaigrette, and season with fresh rosemary, thyme, and basil. Roast it in the oven, on a parchment-lined baking sheet, until all the vegetables are tender. Lightly sauté the fennel in butter with sweet onion slices to "sweat" the vegetables. Add 2/3 cups (150 ml) of vegetable or chicken stock, cover, and braise the side dish for 20 to 25 minutes or until the fennel is tender. Mix thinly sliced sweet anise with the potato slices when you prepare potato au gratin.
